unnormalised: Information Technology (IT) has become as essential as chai in India, hasn't it? From ordering groceries on your phone to running massive government programs, IT is everywhere. But sometimes, all the jargon and abbreviations can be a bit much. Let’s break it down, shall we?
normalised: Information Technology (I-T) has become as essential as chai in India, hasn't it? From ordering groceries on your phone to running massive government programs, I-T is everywhere. But sometimes, all the jargon and abbreviations can be a bit much. Let's break it down, shall we?

unnormalised: Think about it – even the local kirana store uses a POS (Point of Sale) system these days. That's IT in action. Then there's your phone, loaded with apps that connect you to everything from UPI payments to Bollywood gossip. All thanks to IT. The speed at which things have changed is mind-boggling. I remember when a 56k dial-up connection was considered high-speed internet!
normalised: Think about it – even the local kirana store uses a P-O-S (Point of Sale) system these days. That's I-T in action. Then there's your phone, loaded with apps that connect you to everything from U-P-I payments to Bollywood gossip. All thanks to I-T. The speed at which things have changed is mind-boggling. I remember when a fifty six k dial-up connection was considered high-speed internet!

unnormalised: Companies are investing heavily in cloud computing (AWS, Azure, GCP - you name it!). This allows them to store data and run applications remotely, which is a big deal for scalability. Cybersecurity is also a major concern. With so many cyber threats looming, companies need to protect themselves with firewalls, antivirus software, and a whole lot of vigilance. After all, a data breach could cost them crores, not just lakhs.
normalised: Companies are investing heavily in cloud computing (A-W-S, Azure, G-C-P - you name it!). This allows them to store data and run applications remotely, which is a big deal for scalability. Cybersecurity is also a major concern. With so many cyber threats looming, companies need to protect themselves with firewalls, antivirus software, and a whole lot of vigilance. After all, a data breach could cost them crores, not just lakhs.

unnormalised: Data Science and AI are the new rockstars of IT. Everyone’s talking about machine learning algorithms that can predict consumer behavior or diagnose diseases with 99% accuracy (some say!). Of course, there's a debate on whether AI will steal our jobs, but it's definitely creating new opportunities. You now have data scientists earning packages upwards of Rs. 25 LPA straight out of college, which is insane!
normalised: Data Science and A-I are the new rockstars of I-T. Everyone's talking about machine learning algorithms that can predict consumer behavior or diagnose diseases with ninety nine percent accuracy (some say!). Of course, there's a debate on whether A-I will steal our jobs, but it's definitely creating new opportunities. You now have data scientists earning packages upwards of rupees twenty five L-P-A straight out of college, which is insane!

unnormalised: The government's push for Digital India has fueled the IT sector even further. From Aadhaar cards to online tax filing, IT is at the heart of these initiatives. India has also become a major outsourcing hub, with companies like TCS and Infosys providing IT services to clients across the globe. This has created employment for millions of Indians, even in Tier 2 and 3 cities. The total IT revenue for FY 2023-24 is projected to be around $250 billion.
normalised: The government's push for Digital India has fueled the I-T sector even further. From Aadhaar cards to online tax filing, I-T is at the heart of these initiatives. India has also become a major outsourcing hub, with companies like T-C-S and Infosys providing I-T services to clients across the globe. This has created employment for millions of Indians, even in Tier two and three cities. The total I-T revenue for F-Y two thousand twenty three two thousand twenty four is projected to be around dollar two hundred and fifty billion.

unnormalised: So, from smartphones to supercomputers, IT has transformed India in profound ways. And with new technologies like Web 3.0 and the Metaverse on the horizon, the ride has only just begun. So, buckle up and enjoy it, because it's going to be a wild one!
